title: Add rendering and end-to-end determinism tests
intent: Create tests/test_render.py with tests for ASCII rendering correctness, solution overlay, and byte-level determinism of the full pipeline.
forbidden: Do not modify any other existing files
notes: IMPORTANT: Read mazegen/render.py, mazegen/generate.py, mazegen/solve.py, and mazegen/types.py carefully to learn the EXACT function signatures. Use those exact names in all test calls. Do not import any external dependencies — use only stdlib and the mazegen package. tests/test_render.py must import render_ascii from mazegen.render, generate from mazegen.generate, solve from mazegen.solve, and types from mazegen.types. Include at least these test cases: (1) render_ascii returns a non-empty string for a generated maze, (2) output has exactly 2*height + 1 lines (standard ASCII maze format), (3) determinism: same maze renders to identical strings, (4) solution overlay: when a solved path is provided, the output contains '*' characters, (5) solution overlay without --solve: no '*' characters in output, (6) end-to-end determinism: generate(w,h,seed) -> solve -> render_ascii produces identical output across two calls. Do NOT guess parameter names — read them from the source.
